data.name: Tangela
data.flavorText: It tangles any moving thing with its vines. Their subtle shaking is ticklish if you get ensnared.

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Tangrowth
data.flavorText: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can't even see its eyes.

attacks.name: Hefty Whip
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was healed during this turn, this attack does 130 more damage.

data.name: Scyther
data.flavorText: While young, they live together deep in the mountains, training themselves in how to fight with their scythes and move at high speeds.

attacks.name: Fury Cutter
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 20 more damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 50 more damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.name: Pinsir
data.flavorText: One solid blow from its horns is enough to split apart a large tree. Its greatest rival in Alola is Vikavolt.

attacks.name: Grip and Squeeze
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Chikorita
data.flavorText: It uses the leaf on its head to determine the temperature and humidity. It loves to sunbathe.

attacks.name: Synthesis
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Bayleef
data.flavorText: The buds that ring its neck give off a spicy aroma that perks people up.

attacks.name: Soothing Scent
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Chikorita
data.flavorText: It uses the leaf on its head to determine the temperature and humidity. It loves to sunbathe.

attacks.name: Mini Drain
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Spinarak
data.flavorText: Some fishermen weave its sturdy thread into nets to catch fish Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spider Scram
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned. Put this Pokémon and all cards attached to it in the Lost Zone.

data.name: Ariados
data.flavorText: It spins thread from both its rear and its mouth. Then it wraps its prey up in thread and sips their bodily fluids at its leisure.

attacks.name: Trapping Thread
attacks.text: Whenever your opponent plays an Item or Supporter card from their hand during their next turn, prevent all effects of that card done to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Meganium
data.flavorText: Meganium's breath has the power to revive dead grass and plants. It can make them healthy again.

abilities.name: Quick-Ripening Herb
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this Ability. Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 2 card in your hand that evolves from that Pokémon, put that card onto the Basic Pokémon to evolve it. You can use this Ability during your first turn or on a Pokémon that was put into play this turn.

data.name: Hoppip
data.flavorText: It drifts on winds. It is said that when Hoppip gather in fields and mountains, spring is on the way.

attacks.name: Multiply
attacks.text: Search your deck for Hoppip and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Hoppip
data.flavorText: It drifts on winds. It is said that when Hoppip gather in fields and mountains, spring is on the way.

data.name: Skiploom
data.flavorText: It spreads its petals to absorb sunlight. It also floats in the air to get closer to the sun.

abilities.name: Floral Path to the Sky
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for Jumpluff, put this Pokémon and all cards attached to it in the Lost Zone, and put that Jumpluff in its place. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Jumpluff
data.flavorText: Even in the fiercest wind, it can control its fluff to make its way to any place in the world it wants.

attacks.name: Lost March
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Pokémon, except ◇ (Prism Star) Pokémon, in the Lost Zone.

data.name: Pineco
data.flavorText: It looks just like a pinecone. Its shell protects it from bird Pokémon that peck it by mistake.

attacks.name: Continuous Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.name: Shuckle
data.flavorText: It stores berries inside its shell. To avoid attacks, it hides beneath rocks and remains completely still.

abilities.name: Fresh Squeezed
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and discard them. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Energy Drink
attacks.text: Attach 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Shuckle-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Protective Shell
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon that have 2 or fewer Energy attached to them.

attacks.name: Triple Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 3 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Wrap-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Heracross
data.flavorText: With its Herculean powers, it can easily throw around an object that is 100 times its own weight.

attacks.name: Powerful Friends
attacks.text: If you have any Stage 2 Pokémon on your Bench, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Grovyle
data.flavorText: It lives in dense jungles. While closing in on its prey, it leaps from branch to branch.

abilities.name: Sunshine Grace
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Grass Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Celebi ◇
data.flavorText: It has the power to travel across time, but it is said to appear only in peaceful times.
rules: ◇ (Prism Star) Rule: You can't have more than 1 ◇ card with the same name in your deck. If a ◇ card would go to the discard pile, put it in the Lost Zone instead.

attacks.name: Time Distortion
attacks.text: Devolve any number of your Benched Pokémon as many times as you like. Put each Evolution card removed this way into your hand.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Treecko
data.flavorText: Small hooks on the bottom of its feet catch on walls and ceilings. That is how it can hang from above.

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Wurmple
data.flavorText: It lives among the tall grass and in forests. It repels attacks by raising up the spikes on its rear.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Sceptile-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mach Cut
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Leaf Cyclone
attacks.text: Move a Grass Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Jungle Heal-GX
attacks.text: Heal all damage from each of your Pokémon that has any Grass Energy attached to it. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Wurmple
data.flavorText: It lives among the tall grass and in forests. It repels attacks by raising up the spikes on its rear.

data.name: Silcoon
data.flavorText: It drinks dew that collects on its silk and waits for evolution. Its hard cocoon repels attacks.

attacks.name: Cocoon Collector
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 4 in any combination of Silcoon and Cascoon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Beautifly
data.flavorText: It has an aggressive nature. It stabs prey with its long, narrow mouth to drain the prey's fluids.

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Butterfly Edge
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Cascoon
data.flavorText: It never forgets any attack it endured while in the cocoon. After evolution, it seeks payback.

attacks.name: Cocoon Collector
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 4 in any combination of Silcoon and Cascoon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Dustox
data.flavorText: It violently flutters its wings to scatter toxic dust when attacked. It becomes active after sunset.

abilities.name: Hazardous Evolution
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may leave your opponent's Active Pokémon Paralyzed and Poisoned. If you do, put 3 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

data.name: Nincada
data.flavorText: It can sometimes live underground for more than 10 years. It absorbs nutrients from the roots of trees.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Vespiquen
data.flavorText: Its abdomen is a honeycomb for grubs. It raises its grubs on honey collected by Combee.

attacks.name: Commanding Queen
attacks.text: If you have 4 or fewer Grass Pokémon on your Bench, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Combee
data.flavorText: It collects and delivers honey to its colony. At night, they cluster to form a beehive and sleep.

attacks.name: Bee March
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Combee and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Shaymin
data.flavorText: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.

abilities.name: Floral Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 20 damage from your Active Grass Pokémon.

data.name: Ninjask
data.flavorText: Because it moves so quickly, it sometimes becomes unseeable. It congregates around tree sap.

abilities.name: Molting
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put a Shedinja from your discard pile onto your Bench.

attacks.name: X-Scissor
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Virizion-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Double Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Sensitive Blade
attacks.text: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

attacks.name: Breeze Away-GX
attacks.text: Put any number of your Pokémon in play and all cards attached to them into your hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Skiddo
data.flavorText: If it has sunshine and water, it doesn't need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Gogoat
data.flavorText: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.

attacks.name: Leaf Wallop
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Leaf Wallop attack does 50 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Tapu Bulu
data.flavorText: The guardian deity of Ula'ula is a lazy Pokémon. It commands plants to immobilize its foes and then deals them a savage blow with its horns.

attacks.name: Heavy Punch
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Wild Tackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Cyndaquil
data.flavorText: It has a timid nature. If it is startled, the flames on its back burn more vigorously.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

data.name: Moltres
data.flavorText: One of the legendary bird Pokémon. It is said that its appearance indicates the coming of spring.

attacks.name: Assisting Heater
attacks.text: You may attach a Fire Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Cyndaquil
data.flavorText: It has a timid nature. If it is startled, the flames on its back burn more vigorously.

data.name: Quilava
data.flavorText: Be careful if it turns its back during battle. It means that it will attack with the fire on its back.

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Typhlosion
data.flavorText: It has a secret, devastating move. It rubs its blazing fur together to cause huge explosions.

abilities.name: Blazing Energy
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this Ability. All Energy attached to your Pokémon are Fire Energy instead of their usual type until the end of your turn. (This includes cards that come into play on this turn.)

attacks.name: Lost Flame
attacks.text: Put 2 Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon in the Lost Zone.

data.name: Slugma
data.flavorText: Its body is made of magma. If it doesn't keep moving, its body will cool and harden.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Houndour
data.flavorText: To corner prey, they check each other's location using barks that only they can understand.

attacks.name: Team Hunt
attacks.text: Draw a card for each of your Houndour in play.

data.name: Houndoom
data.flavorText: The flames it breathes when angry contain toxins. If they cause a burn, it will hurt forever.

attacks.name: Nasty Plot
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Attack Operation
attacks.text: If you have more cards in your hand than your opponent, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Entei
data.flavorText: It is said that when it roars, a volcano erupts somewhere around the globe.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Eruption
attacks.text: Each player discards the top card of their deck. This attack does 60 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

data.name: Magcargo-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Crushing Charge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard the top card of your deck. If it's a basic Energy card, attach it to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Lava Flow
attacks.text: Discard any amount of basic Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 50 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Burning Magma-GX
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your opponent's deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Heatran
data.flavorText: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.

attacks.name: Lava Burn
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Heat Bazooka
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck.

data.name: Pyroar
data.flavorText: With fiery breath of more than 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, they viciously threaten any challenger. The females protect the pride's cubs.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Victini
data.flavorText: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being's entire body will be overflowing with power.

attacks.name: V-Beatdown
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Basic Pokémon in play.

data.name: Litleo
data.flavorText: They set off on their own from their pride and live by themselves to become stronger. These hot-blooded Pokémon are quick to fight.

abilities.name: Wild Dash
abilities.text: If your opponent has any Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX in play, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Blacephalon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Bursting Burn
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned and Confused.

attacks.name: Mind Blown
attacks.text: Put any amount of Fire Energy attached to your Pokémon in the Lost Zone. This attack does 50 damage for each card put in the Lost Zone in this way.

attacks.name: Burst-GX
attacks.text: Discard 1 of your Prize cards. If it's an Energy card, attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Alolan Vulpix
data.flavorText: In hot weather, this Pokémon makes ice shards with its six tails and sprays them around to cool itself off.

abilities.name: Secret Alleyway
abilities.text: If you have any Fairy Pokémon in play, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

data.name: Lapras
data.flavorText: These Pokémon were once near extinction due to poaching. Following protective regulations, there is now an overabundance of them.

abilities.name: Go for a Swim
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put them back in any order.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Slowking
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is so famed for its intellect that a proverb still persists in some regions: "When in doubt, ask Slowking."

attacks.name: Memory Melt
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand and put a card you find there in the Lost Zone.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Slowpoke
data.flavorText: Alolan home cooking involves drying Slowpoke tails and then simmering them into a salty stew.

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Delibird
data.flavorText: It has a generous habit of sharing its food with people and Pokémon, so it's always scrounging around for more food.

attacks.name: Happy Delivery
attacks.text: Choose any number of your Benched Pokémon that don't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to them. For each of those Pokémon, search your deck for a Pokémon Tool card and attach it to that Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Mantine
data.flavorText: While elegantly swimming in the sea, it ignores Remoraid that cling to its fins seeking food scraps.

abilities.name: Mantine Surf
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Energy attached to it, it has no Retreat Cost.

data.name: Suicune
data.flavorText: Said to be the embodiment of north winds, it can instantly purify filthy, murky water.

abilities.name: Frozen Flow
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, you may have your opponent switch their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aurora Gain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Suicune-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Phantom Winds
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may shuffle it and all cards attached to it into your deck.

attacks.name: Cure Stream
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 30 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Brinicles-GX
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Beartic
data.flavorText: It freezes its breath to create fangs and claws of ice to fight with. Cold northern areas are its habitat.

attacks.name: Resolute Claws
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon-GX or a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 60 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Blizzard Burn
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Cubchoo
data.flavorText: Their snot is a barometer of health. When healthy, their snot is sticky and the power of their ice moves increases.

attacks.name: Secondary Chills
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if you go second, and only on your first turn. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: White Kyurem
data.flavorText: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

attacks.name: Field Crush
attacks.text: If your opponent has a Stadium card in play, discard it.

attacks.name: Freezing Flames
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Fire Energy attached to it, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Popplio
data.flavorText: This Pokémon can control water bubbles. It practice diligently so it can learn to make big bubbles.

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Primarina
data.flavorText: Its singing voice is its chief weapon in battle. This Pokémon's Trainer must prioritize the daily maintenance of its throat at all costs.

abilities.name: Harmonics
abilities.text: Whenever you attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, except with an attack, Ability, or Trainer card, attach up to 2 Energy cards to that Pokémon instead of 1.

attacks.name: Hypno Splash
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Brionne
data.flavorText: It cares deeply for its companions. When its Trainer is feeling down, it performs a cheery dance to try and help.

attacks.name: Captivate
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

data.name: Popplio
data.flavorText: This Pokémon snorts body fluids from its nose, blowing balloons to smash into its foes. It's famous for being a hard worker.

attacks.name: Disarming Voice
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Toxapex
data.flavorText: Those attacked by Toxapex's poison will suffer intense pain for three days and three nights. Post-recovery, there will be some aftereffects.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Venom Fever
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 50 damage for each damage counter on that Pokémon.

data.name: Mareanie
data.flavorText: It's found crawling on beaches and seafloors. The coral that grows on Corsola's head is as good as a five-star banquet to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spike Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

data.name: Bruxish
data.flavorText: It stuns its prey with psychokinesis and then grinds them to mush with its strong teeth. Even Shellder's shell is no match for it.

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Follow the Wound
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Electabuzz
data.flavorText: Electricity leaks from it in amounts far greater than the amount of electricity it eats.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Electivire
data.flavorText: When it gets excited, it thumps its chest. With every thud, thunder roars and electric sparks shower all around.

attacks.name: Electrocharge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Lightning Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: High-Voltage Knuckle
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Chinchou
data.flavorText: It lives in the depths beyond the reach of sunlight. It flashes lights on its antennae to communicate with others of its kind.

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Mareep
data.flavorText: It stores lots of air in its soft fur, allowing it to stay cool in summer and warm in winter.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Ampharos
data.flavorText: The tail's tip shines brightly and can be seen from far away. It acts as a beacon for lost people.

abilities.name: Unseen Flash
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put 2 Lightning Energy cards from your hand in the Lost Zone. If you do, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Split Bomb
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Flaaffy
data.flavorText: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. It fires hair that zaps on impact.

attacks.name: Signal Beam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Mareep
data.flavorText: It stores lots of air in its soft fur, allowing it to stay cool in summer and warm in winter.

abilities.name: Fluffy Pillow
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, you may leave your opponent's Active Pokémon Asleep.

data.name: Lanturn
data.flavorText: This Pokémon flashes a bright light that blinds its prey. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electrical attack.

attacks.name: Salvage
attacks.text: Shuffle 4 Item cards from your discard pile into your deck.

attacks.name: Signal Beam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Raikou
data.flavorText: This rough Pokémon stores energy inside its body, then sweeps across the land, shooting off electricity.

attacks.name: Lost Voltage
attacks.text: If you have any Lightning Energy cards in the Lost Zone, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Pachirisu
data.flavorText: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.

attacks.name: Overshort
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tool cards from your opponent's Active Pokémon. If you discarded a Pokémon Tool card in this way, this attack does 40 more damage, and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Blitzle
data.flavorText: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.

data.name: Zebstrika
data.flavorText: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

abilities.name: Sprint
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard your hand and draw 4 cards.

data.name: Tapu Koko
data.flavorText: It confuses its enemies by flying too quickly for the eye to follow. It has a hair-trigger temper but forgets what made it angry an instant later.

attacks.name: Strafe
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flashing Bolt
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Flashing Bolt during your next turn.

data.name: Zeraora-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Thunderclap Zone
abilities.text: Each of your Pokémon that has any Lightning Energy attached to it has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Plasma Fists
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

attacks.name: Full Voltage-GX
attacks.text: Attach 5 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Stunfisk
data.flavorText: It conceals itself in the mud of the seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch it, it delivers a jolt of electricity.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunder Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Lightning Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Dedenne
data.flavorText: It uses its tail to absorb electricity from power plants or from outlets in houses, and then it fires the electricity from its whiskers.

attacks.name: Nuzzle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Nuzzle Shot
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage for each of your Pokémon in play that has the Nuzzle attack to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Natu
data.flavorText: It usually forages for food on the ground bu may, on rare occasions, hop onto branches to peck at shoots.

attacks.name: Lost March
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Pokémon, except ◇ (Prism Star) Pokémon, in the Lost Zone.

data.name: Espeon
data.flavorText: It unleashes psychic power from the orb on its forehead. When its power is exhausted, the orb grows dull and dark.

attacks.name: Allure
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Energy Crush
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.name: Xatu
data.flavorText: They say that it stays still and quiet because it is seeing both the past and future at the same time.

attacks.name: Energy Gaze
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. If you find any Energy cards there, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Unown
data.flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.

abilities.name: MISSING
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, and if your opponent has 12 or more Supporter cards in the Lost Zone, you may use this Ability. If you do, you win this game.

data.name: Unown
data.flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.

abilities.name: DAMAGE
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, and if there are 66 or more damage counters on your Benched Pokémon, you may use this Ability. If you do, you win this game.

data.name: Unown
data.flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.

abilities.name: HAND
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, and if you have 35 or more cards in your hand, you may use this Ability. If you do, you win this game.

data.name: Wobbuffet
data.flavorText: To keep its pitch-black tail hidden, it live quietly in the darkness. It is never first to attack.

abilities.name: Shady Tail
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, ◇ (Prism Star) Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) can't attack and have no Abilities.

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Girafarig
data.flavorText: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent by biting.

attacks.name: Get Lost
attacks.text: Put 2 cards from your opponent's discard pile in the Lost Zone.

attacks.name: Mind Shock
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.name: Shedinja
data.flavorText: A most peculiar Pokémon that somehow appears in a Poké Ball when a Nincada evolves.

abilities.name: Vessel of Life
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard all cards attached to this Pokémon and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon as a Pokémon Tool card. When the Pokémon this card is attached to is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 1 fewer Prize card.

attacks.name: Haunt
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Sableye
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is feared. When its gemstone eyes begin to glow with a sinister shine, it's believed that Sableye will steal people's spirits away.

attacks.name: Quick Hunt
attacks.text: If you go first, you can use this attack on your first turn. Search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Cursed Drop
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Giratina
data.flavorText: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.

abilities.name: Distortion Door
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is in your discard pile, you may put it onto your Bench. If you do, put 1 damage counter on 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shadow Impact
attacks.text: Put 4 damage counters on 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Sigilyph-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Mirror Counter
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon equal to the damage done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sonic Wing
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Intercept-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Cofagrigus
data.flavorText: Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.

attacks.name: Spirit Juggling
attacks.text: Discard any number of your Benched Pokémon. This attack does 30 more damage for each Benched Pokémon you discarded in this way.

data.name: Yamask
data.flavorText: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.

attacks.name: Haunt
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Lampent
data.flavorText: It arrives near the moment of death and steals spirit from the body.

attacks.name: Haunt
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Litwick
data.flavorText: Litwick shines a light that absorbs the life energy of people and Pokémon, which becomes the fuel that it burns.

attacks.name: Haunt
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Chandelure
data.flavorText: The spirits burned up in its ominous flame lose their way and wander this world forever.

attacks.name: Cursed Drop
attacks.text: Put 4 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Vortex of Pain
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each damage counter on all of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.name: Meloetta
data.flavorText: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feels of those who hear it.

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Miracle Harmony
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each of your Pokémon in play that has the Sing attack. This attack does 10 damage for each heads to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Mareanie
data.flavorText: It plunges the poison spike on its head into its prey. When the prey has weakened, Mareanie deals the finishing blow with its 10 tentacles.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Nihilego
data.flavorText: One of the Ultra Beasts, it's unclear whether or not this Pokémon is sentient, but sometimes it can be observed behaving like a young girl.

attacks.name: Nightcap
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if your opponent has exactly 2 Prize cards remaining. Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

attacks.name: Void Tentacles
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

data.name: Poipole
data.flavorText: This Ultra Beast is well enough liked to be chosen as a first partner in its own world.

attacks.name: Eye Opener
attacks.text: Look at your face-down Prize cards.

data.name: Naganadel
data.flavorText: It stores hundreds of liters of poisonous liquid inside its body. It is one of the organisms known as UBs.

abilities.name: Charging Up
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Turning Point
attacks.text: If you have exactly 3 Prize cards remaining, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Onix
data.flavorText: It usually lives underground. It searches for food while boring its way through the ground at 50 miles per hour.

data.name: Phanpy
data.flavorText: It is strong despite its compact size. It can easily pick up and carry an adult human on its back.

attacks.name: Last Resort
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Hitmontop
data.flavorText: If you are enchanted by its smooth, dance-like kicks, you may get a closer experience with one than you'd like.

attacks.name: Rapid Spin
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Triple Kick
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

data.name: Sudowoodo
data.flavorText: Apparently, the larger the green parts of this Pokémon, the more collectors value it. It's a particular favorite among elderly people.

attacks.name: Reply Strongly
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn while it was your Active Pokémon, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Donphan
data.flavorText: The longer and bigger its tusks, the higher its rank in its herd. The tusks take long to grow.

abilities.name: Sturdy
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has full HP and would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, this Pokémon is not Knocked Out, and its remaining HP becomes 10.

attacks.name: Rolling Spin
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Rolling Spin attack does 70 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Carbink
data.flavorText: Although this Pokémon is not especially rare, its glittering, jewel-draped body draws attention from people.

attacks.name: Diamond Gate
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card and a Stadium card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Alolan Meowth
data.flavorText: When its delicate pride is wounded, or when the gold coin on its forehead is dirtied, it flies into a hysterical rage.

attacks.name: Spoil the Fun
attacks.text: If you go second, this attack does 60 more damage during your first turn.

data.name: Alolan Persian
data.flavorText: It looks down on everyone other than itself. Its preferred tactics are sucker punches and blindside attacks.

attacks.name: Empty Threat
attacks.text: This attack does 30 less damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Larvitar
data.flavorText: Born deep underground, it comes aboveground and becomes a pupa once it has finished eating the surrounding soil.

attacks.name: Second Strike
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has 3 or more damage counters on it, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.name: Pupitar
data.flavorText: Its shell is as hard as sheet rock, and it is also very strong. Its thrashing can topple a mountain.

abilities.name: Hard Shell Evolution
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by your opponent's attacks until the end of your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Larvitar
data.flavorText: Born deep underground, it comes aboveground and becomes a pupa once it has finished eating the surrounding soil.

abilities.name: Submerge
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

data.name: Tyranitar-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Lost Out
abilities.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this Pokémon's attacks, put that Pokémon and all cards attached to it in the Lost Zone instead of the discard pile.

attacks.name: Dusty Ruckus
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Basic Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Lay the Smackdown-GX
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Umbreon
data.flavorText: With its black fur, it blends into the darkness. It bides its time, and when prey appears, this Pokémon goes for its threat, and then eats it.

attacks.name: Retaliate
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Alolan Diglett
data.flavorText: Its golden hairs function as sensors. It pokes them out of its burrow to monitor its surroundings.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Alolan Dugtrio
data.flavorText: These Pokémon are cherished in the Alola region, where they are thought to be feminine deities of the land incarnate.

attacks.name: Digging Dash
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.name: Steelix
data.flavorText: It chews its way through boulders with its sturdy jaws. Its eyes can see in the darkness underground.

attacks.name: Iron Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

data.name: Forretress
data.flavorText: It remains immovably rooted to its tree. It scatters piece of its hard shell to drive its enemies away.

attacks.name: Thorny Eruption
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Lost Blast
attacks.text: Put this Pokémon and all cards attached to it in the Lost Zone.

data.name: Scizor
data.flavorText: Once it has identified an enemy, this Pokémon smashes it mercilessly with pincers hard as steel.

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Special Blow
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has any Special Energy attached to it, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.name: Dialga
data.flavorText: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

attacks.name: Turn Back Time
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an evolved Pokémon, devolve it by putting the highest Stage Evolution card on it into your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Power Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Durant
data.flavorText: They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.

attacks.name: Knock Over
attacks.text: You may discard any Stadium card in play.

attacks.name: Mountain Munch
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Cobalion
data.flavorText: It has a body and heart of steel. It worked with its allies to punish people when they hurt Pokémon.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Metal Arms
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Genesect-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Double Drive
abilities.text: This Pokémon may have up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards attached to it. If it loses this Ability, discard Pokémon Tool cards from it until only 1 remains.

attacks.name: Break Buster-GX
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Granbull
data.flavorText: More timid than Snubbull, this Pokémon is doted on by young people amused at the contrast between its looks and its attitude.

attacks.name: All Out
attacks.text: If you have no cards in your hand, this attack does 130 more damage.

data.name: Cutiefly
data.flavorText: Myriads of Cutiefly flutter above the heads of people who have auras resembling those of flowers.

attacks.name: Sweet Scent
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Magearna
data.flavorText: Its mechanized body is merely a vessel. Its true self is its Soul-Heart, an artificial soul.

attacks.name: Minor Errand-Running
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Energy Press
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Alolan Ninetales-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Mysterious Guidance
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 Item cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Snowy Wind
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Sublimation-GX
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Ultra Beast, it is Knocked Out. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Marill
data.flavorText: The tip of its tail is filled with oil that is lighter than water, so it acts as a float.

data.name: Ralts
data.flavorText: It is highly attuned to the emotions of people and Pokémon. It hides if it senses hostility.

attacks.name: Beckon
attacks.text: Put a Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Kirlia
data.flavorText: It has a psychic power that enabled it to distort the space around it and see into the future.

attacks.name: Disarming Voice
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Carbink
data.flavorText: Although this Pokémon is not especially rare, its glittering, jewel-draped body draws attention from people.

attacks.name: Wonder Ray
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by any Pokémon that has an Ability.

data.name: Azumarill
data.flavorText: The bubble-like pattern on its stomach helps it camouflage itself when it's in the water.

attacks.name: Polka-Dot Search
attacks.text: Look at the top 8 cards of your deck and attach any number of Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

attacks.name: Play Rough
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Snubbull
data.flavorText: Its growls make its opponents uneasy. This laid-back Pokémon tends to sleep half the day.

attacks.name: Make a Mess
attacks.text: Discard up to 2 Trainer cards from your hand. This attack does 20 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Dedenne
data.flavorText: It uses its tail to absorb electricity from power plants or from outlets in houses, and then it fires the electricity from its whiskers.

attacks.name: Zzzap Touch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Xerneas ◇
data.flavorText: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.
rules: ◇ (Prism Star) Rule: You can't have more than 1 ◇ card with the same name in your deck. If a ◇ card would go to the discard pile, put it in the Lost Zone instead.

abilities.name: Path of Life
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when this Pokémon moves from your Bench to become your Active Pokémon, you may move any number of Energy from your other Pokémon to it.

attacks.name: Bright Horns
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Bright Horns during your next turn.

data.name: Shiinotic
data.flavorText: It emits flickering spores that cause drowsiness. When its prey succumb to sleep, this Pokémon feeds on them by sucking in their energy.

abilities.name: Effect Spore
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dream's Touch
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Asleep, your opponent shuffles all Energy from it into their deck.

data.name: Tapu Lele
data.flavorText: As it flutters about, it scatters its strangely glowing scales. Touching them is said to restore good health on the spot.

abilities.name: Charmed Charm
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a Pokémon Tool card that has "Fairy Charm" in its name from your hand to this Pokémon during your turn, you may leave your opponent's Active Pokémon Confused.

data.name: Mimikyu-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Perplex
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Let's Snuggle & Fall
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dream Fear-GX
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. Your opponent shuffles that Pokémon and all cards attached to it into their deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Jigglypuff
data.flavorText: Jigglypuff posses a vocal range that exceeds 12 octaves, but each individual's singing skill depends on its own effort.

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Wigglytuff
data.flavorText: As it inhales, it expands…and expands…and expands. Wigglytuff compete to see which one can inflate itself the most.

attacks.name: Expand
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Charmed Slap
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card that has "Fairy Charm" in its name attached to it, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.name: Gardevoir
data.flavorText: It has the power to predict the future. Its power peaks when it is protecting its Trainer.

attacks.name: Brilliant Search
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Sensitive Ray
attacks.text: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Ribombee
data.flavorText: Some of Ribombee's pollen puffs are highly nutritious. They are sometimes sold as supplements.

abilities.name: Mysterious Buzz
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, whenever your opponent plays a Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to your Fairy Pokémon in play.

data.name: Morelull
data.flavorText: As it drowses the day away, it nourishes itself by sucking from tree roots. It wakens at the fall of night, wandering off in search of a new tree.

attacks.name: Perplex
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Tapu Fini
data.flavorText: The guardian deity of Poni, it can control water. People say it can create pure water that will wash away any uncleanness.

attacks.name: Dream Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent shuffles their Active Pokémon and all cards attached to it into their deck.

attacks.name: Wonder Shine
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Chansey
data.flavorText: Not only are these Pokémon fast runners, they're also few in number, so anyone who finds one must be lucky indeed.

attacks.name: Healing Pirouette
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sympathetic Slap
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it before this attack does damage, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Ditto ◇
data.flavorText: With its astonishing capacity for metamorphosis, it can get along with anything. It does not get along well with its fellow Ditto.
rules: ◇ (Prism Star) Rule: You can't have more than 1 ◇ card with the same name in your deck. If a ◇ card would go to the discard pile, put it in the Lost Zone instead.

abilities.name: Almighty Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put any Stage 1 card from your hand onto this Pokémon to evolve it. You can't use this Ability during your first turn or the turn this Pokémon was put into play.

data.name: Eevee
data.flavorText: Current studies show it can evolve into an incredible eight different species of Pokémon.

data.name: Blissey
data.flavorText: Its fluffy fur coat acts as a sensor, enabling it to read the feelings of people and Pokémon.

abilities.name: Happiness Supplement
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may remove a Special Condition from your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Powerful Slap
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

data.name: Lugia-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pelagic Blade
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Pelagic Blade during your next turn.

attacks.name: Lost Purge-GX
attacks.text: Put your opponent's Active Pokémon and all cards attached to it in the Lost Zone. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Ho-Oh
data.flavorText: It will reveal itself before a pure-hearted Trainer by shining its bright, rainbow-colored wings.

attacks.name: Rainbow Burn
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each type of basic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Miltank
data.flavorText: Most people raise it for its milk, but it's quite tough and strong, so it's also well suited for battle.

attacks.name: Milk Cannon
attacks.text: Reveal any number of Moomoo Milk cards in your hand. This attack does 60 damage for each card you revealed in this way.

data.name: Kecleon
data.flavorText: It changes its shading to match its surroundings so it can sneak up on prey. Only its belly patterns stay fixed.

abilities.name: Unit Color 1
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon has Unit Energy GrassFireWater attached to it, it is a Grass, Fire, and Water Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tongue Smack
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.name: Pikipek
data.flavorText: This Pokémon feeds on berries, whose leftover seeds become the ammunition for attacks it fires off from its mouth.

attacks.name: Send Back
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Trumbeak
data.flavorText: By bending its beak, it can produce a variety of calls and brand itself a noisy nuisance for its neighbors.

abilities.name: Mountain Pass
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is in your hand, you may reveal it. If you do, look at the top card of your opponent's deck and put this Pokémon in the Lost Zone. If that card is a Supporter card, you may put it in the Lost Zone. If your opponent has no cards in their deck, you can't use this Ability.

data.name: Toucannon
data.flavorText: Within its beak, its internal gas ignites, explosively launching seeds with enough power to pulverize boulders.

attacks.name: Heat Beak
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Giganticannon
attacks.text: If this Pokémon evolved during this turn, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Adventure Bag
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Counter Gain
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, the attacks of the Pokémon this card is attached to cost Colorless less.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Aether Foundation Employee
rules: Put 3 Pokémon that have "Alolan" in their names from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Electropower
rules: During this turn, your Lightning Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Spell Tag
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
When the Psychic Pokémon this card is attached to is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, put 4 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
